data.text: @sammdeighan I'm quite lucky. Omnicon strain plus x 3 vaxxed means the symptoms have been quite mild.

@Pulpcurry Still not seen S1 though it’s been high on my ‘to watch’ list for years -  as a fan of David Simon’s work and most of the writers on the show. May have to bite the bullet and watch it soon. (My ‘excuse’ is that I have so little free time to commit to a series like this.)
@Pulpcurry Absolutely. This variant seems far easier to catch though.
@BlackHoleMovies Better, thanks for asking. I am just glad I did not catch the original strain pre vaccine!

@Pulpcurry I enjoyed the series, but don’t remember the last season being better or worse than the others.

I will say nothing of the final episode.
@Pulpcurry I didn't even know they made a season 2, let alone 3. I liked the first season.  Growing up in the 70' in NYC area, I liked the grittyness of the show.

@Pulpcurry The women who lived it consulted on the show, and the production did a great job of recreating 42nd street as it was in the era, sleazy, dangerous, and exhilarating. The characters  grow and change in unexpected ways. Powerful performances, terrific story arcs. Gritty yet tender.
@Pulpcurry Season 3 is still very strong, and has some unforgettable moments that stay with you.
@Pulpcurry I loved this show from debut to finale. S2 is great, but there's a moment in S3 I haven't been able to shake in years. Keep watching
